#```{r}
scatterGraphHelper(CPS85)
```
#```{r}
ggplot(data=CPS85,aes(x=educ,y=wage))+
  geom_point()+
  aes(colour=sex)+
  scale_y_log10()+
  facet_wrap(~union,ncol-4)+
  stat_smooth(method-lm)
```

- first one is scatter plot and the second one is density plot

-first one with wage,married, exper, and second one with bmi and sex.

-It gives frame to the graphic

-Since it is density, it shows where the the population is at certain bmi.

#```{r}
ggplot(data=CPS85, aes(x=exper,y=wage))+
  geom_point(married)+
  facet_wrap(sector)
```
#```{r}
ggplot (data=NCHS, aes(x=bmi))+
  geom_density(aes(color=blue))+
  facet_wrap(sex)
```
